title: Tales Of The Red Canyon
opening: Sothis has a request for you, Byleth... At her insistence, you travel alone to the Red Canyon, followed by curious students.

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Hmmm... What was that name again?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What's on your mind?

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Oh, this is frustrating me to no end! I simply can't recall. Oh, I have it! Zanado!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Zanado, the Red Canyon?

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: That's it! It was not long ago that we were there... And still, I somehow managed to forget!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Where we defeated the thieves....

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: That's it! It was not long ago that we were there... And still, I somehow managed to forget!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What is that?

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Oh my, your memory is even worse than mine. It was not long ago that we were there!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: What about it?

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Well... That place brought back some fragments of my memory. I cannot help but wonder why. I feel we must return to find some answers there.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's go.

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Yes, you are right! For as the saying goes, there is no time like the present.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Now isn't the time.

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: No? You must delight in spoiling my mood... Well, if you refuse to go, there's little I can do... Please tell me if you change your mind.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Hmm... Our professor is sneaking off alone. Where to, I wonder...

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: I don't recall hearing of any such plans for our class. Perhaps we should follow.

intro.speaker: Edelgard
intro.line: Intrigued, are we? Yes, let's do just that. We will consider it...extra training.

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: It is most unlike our professor to go wandering alone like that...

intro.speaker: Dedue
intro.line: Curious, Your Highness?

intro.speaker: Dimitri
intro.line: Yes. I have an uneasy feeling about this. Let's gather the others and find out what is going on.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Huh? Where's our professor going all alone like that?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I hate not knowing what's going on... OK, that's it. Let's gather the others and get to the bottom of this.

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: You want to follow our teacher?! What a pain... Ugh, but I guess I'm dying of curiosity too.

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Yes... It is all coming back to me. This structure... Oh, but it's as though my memories are clouded. The most important pieces are obscured. But I once called this home. I have no doubt. I seem to recall something...on the other side of that wall. I cannot see it, but I can still feel it... It is not my imagination. I know this to be true. We are already deep within this valley...
Grrrraargh!

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Oh! What was that awful sound?!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: You heard something?

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: This is not time to joke around! Do not pretend you didn't hear!

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: It was a terrible scream.

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Yes. And that was not a normal beast, but a huge and terrifying one!

intro.speaker: Sothis
intro.line: Look! There! At the entrance of the valley...a giant shadow!

battle.speaker: Sothis
battle.line: What is it now?!

battle.speaker: Sothis
battle.line: Those hungry wolves... That howl must have riled them up. We have no choice but to fight our way out. Give it your all!

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: It's good we've caught up with the professor, but this situation is--hard to put into words, actually.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Wolves to the front, hawks to the rear, and what appears to be a Demonic Beast at the canyon's mouth...

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: A wild beast, at that. Or perhaps it's more fitting to call it a stray.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: If we can't prevail over that Demonic Beast, we won't make it out of the Red Canyon alive.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: The first thing we need to do is reunite with our professor. The wolves are closing in...

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: More hawks... This is bad. We'll be caught from both sides!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: The hawks are still coming. Perhaps we should see to those before we deal with the beast.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: This is bad... It's a good thing we managed to catch up with our professor.

battle.speaker: Dedue
battle.line: Wolves at the front. Hawks at the rear. And at the canyon mouth, a Demonic Beast.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Or perhaps to call it a stray beast would be most fitting... If we cannot take out the beast, I doubt we will ever see the monastery again.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: We must help our professor, first and foremost. This is a tough situation for anyone.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: They must hope to catch us from both sides.

battle.speaker: Dimitri
battle.line: Blast! More hawks! We should probably take those out before we approach that beast...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: It was the right move for us to follow Teach. But however you look at it, we're in a tough spot now...

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Wolves, hawks...not to mention a Demonic Beast guarding the canyon's entrance! We should never have come here.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Don't say that! But what's a Demonic Beast doing here? Is it a stray? Even Teach would have trouble out here all alone. Let's help out before we're down one professor!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: First thing's first. We need to reunite with Teach. Hurry up, everyone!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Great...more hawks. Those feathery jerks are trying to take us out from both sides!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: More hawks?! The air's swarming with those feathered freaks! Let's get them before we fight the beast.

boss.speaker: Sothis
boss.line: This thing... It has no will or mind to call its own. You must now strike it down! That is the best you can hope to offer this poor, lost soul.

boss.speaker: Claude
boss.line: Do you think it was once a human, like Miklan? No... It's not possible...

boss.speaker: Flayn
boss.line: Let us put an end to its suffering. I think that is the most honorable thing we can do at this point.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Our work is done? My, my... Things did not go as planned. Let us return, before any more hawks or wolves join us. But what was that Demonic Beast doing within the Red Canyon...

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: I'm glad you are safe, Professor. It was rather reckless of you to venture out alone like that.

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: I suppose we came out here without permission too. If we all wish to avoid punishment... Perhaps we can all agree that we came out here for an extra-curricular activity. Let's leave it at that.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Still, I would like to know what brought you to this valley in the first place...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Professor, I am so glad that you are unharmed. What if something had happened to you?

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: Your Highness, our instructor is safe. We should return to the monastery at once.

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Yes, I suppose you are right. If we stay here much longer, we are sure to be reprimanded.

end.speaker: Dedue
end.line: It is not untrue to assert that our professor led us here for battle experience...

end.speaker: Dimitri
end.line: Dedue, you surprise me! And you, Professor. I hope you will tell us what brought you here...

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Listen, Teach. No one likes aimless wandering more than me, but it's not worth dying over.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Well, we're all OK now, so let's just focus on the positive. Ooh, maybe we can tell folks back at the monastery that we came here for battle training? With our dear professor's permission?

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: Hilda, you scamp! No one has a knack for getting out of trouble quite like you do. It is a gift, milady.

end.speaker: Hilda
end.line: Oh, is that right? Well, no one can get into trouble quite like you, so it works out!

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Oh dear... I put us in a bit of danger there! We are most fortunate that those delinquents followed us... You very nearly met your end! What a marvelous professor you must be, for all your students to be so concerned.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm proud of us.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Hmm, you seem more confident in your ability to teach. But that makes sense, as you have me to help you out.

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I'm not used to it yet.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: You are not used to it? Hm. You must start thinking of yourself as a professor here. Be confident, as you have me to help you out.

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: How disappointing to have dived so deep into danger, and yet to have nothing to show. Huh? What is this...strange feeling... My memories... Do you feel them stirring? How curious. You seem to have grown stronger! And all thanks to our journey to Zanado. It really was worth all that effort!

end.speaker: Byleth
end.line: I found something...

end.speaker: Sothis
end.line: Huh? You found this? I daresay you may find a use for that. You should decide how best to use that thing. But wow! We got a lot out of this trip. It was a bother for a spell, but in the end, I feel we should think fondly of our little trip. We actually had a delightful time, wouldn't you say?
